trial_identification.studytitle: Upper airways resistance in obstructive sleep apnoea at simulated altitude
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Human voluteer study; Does sleep at simulated high altitude alter upper airway resistance in people with obstructive sleep apnoea?

interventions.interventions: Overnight sleep for more than six hours at sea level and at simulated altitude of 2750m. The two study nights are separated by at least one week.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Resistence is measured prior to all apnoeas and hypopnoeas during each study night

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pattern of breathing during periods of supplemental Oxygen and Carbon Dioxide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During each 10-15 minute periods when the gas mixtures are administered. This will usually be 4-6 hours after the sleep study has started.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Alteration in the pattern of breathing during exposure to simulated high altitude during sleep
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During each 10-15 minute period when the gas mix is administered during overnight sleep study. This will usually be between 4 and 6 hours after the study starts.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Coexistent significant other organ disease. Desaturation below 65% at sea level.

trial_design.concealment: Subjects are enrolled prior to the first study night.They are allocated on the first study night by the toss of a coin to either of the two study arms.
trial_design.sequence: Toss of a coin is used to determine which is the initial study condition

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Unit 2/Building 7, 49 Frenchs Forest Road Frenchs Forest NSW 2086

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Unit 2/ Building 7, 49 Frenchs Forest Road Frenchs Forest NSW 2086

ethicsAndSummary.summary: There is no update to the original ethics submission
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Burgess KR, Saye P, Cheong M, Lee CS, Worthington JM. Upper airway resistance in OSA patients during exposure to simulated high altitude. American Thoracic Society International Conference, Toronto 2008.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Vinden House Royal North Shore Hospital Campus St. Leonards. NSW
